instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - memtest error.
threads.message:
Run OSX fine, but an application like Final Cut crashes during encoding.

i then run memtest, on last 3/4 stages, there's a lot of errors.

worth replacing 32 ram chips? do 1 side at a time and test?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - memtest error.
threads.message:
Calculate how much will cost half of chips, think about the time need to invest and the money you can get for repair.
It may worth, if you replace the bad chips in the first step (half chips).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - memtest error.
threads.message: I've already got the exact chips, same code and everything, i nick them from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook pro 13" 2012. this board is very expensive, its one of these board has an AMD GPU. i think it is worth trying
